well...there are problems

compared to the earlier seasons, kill time has decreased by 33% without the influence of the damage and stats from runes

when the damage is factored in, it can get even lower

for example Four {{item:3031}} and {{item:3036}}  in the previous seasons would hit for about 1150 damage before armor resists and penetration but would only have 1 attack per second

{{item:3031}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3072}}  {{item:3812}} leaves you at about 340 AD at level 18, but with runes you can increase your attack speed to the cap

against caitlyn who has 87.5 armor at 18, the first does  733 damage per auto attack

with runes factored in now, if you get max attack speed for the second build or for some carries about 2.0.  I'll use the 2.0 amount here

340 * 2 = 680 - 68 = 612 * armor value + 68 true damage per hit  = 326 physical damage per hit and 68 true damage per hit at 2 attacks per second = 652 physical and 136 true or 788 total damage per second

if the champion has higher attack speed, the value goes up

take tristana.  if she manages to damage a champion at all, she will then have around 2.7 attack speed

113(base) + 240(items) + 12(shards)  (up to 12 if you use ghost poro and up to 18 with eyeball collection, though that's less reliable and since ghost is only factored on level, it's more reliable) = 377 AD * 2(critical) = 754 - 75 = 679 + 75 true damage = 362 physical + 75 true damage per auto

362 + 75 = 437 * 2.7 = 1179.9 (or effectively 1180) damage per second in addition to static shiv's magic damage and if you have chosen cheap shot over a hunter and the opponent is crowd controlled, 40 more true damage per auto, up to 108 more effective damage per second

733 is a lot less than a potential 1288

though for the sake of it, i'll do tristana in calculations with the AD build

113 + 360 = 473 * 2.5 = 1182.5 * armor value = 753.7 so 754 if rounded per auto.  With her kit, she will end up with roughly 1.5 attack speed then (or more by previous rune system but not much) for 754 * 1.5 = 1131 damage per second

nnng, so it ends up less than 20% difference.  It does show what a difference the change in items caused though as she would end up with over 2.3 attack speed in the current system
